name: mira
text: The Aibo has given Roast Beef balls.

name: sumisueme
text: First a lung, now balls; this is the natural order of Things You Get From Aibos.

name: wonelove
text: his whole cardio-pulmonary system, actually.

name: evilbobikus
text: Perhaps the fact that Beef is in fact part AIBO helps strengthen his bond with Weldon.

name: thesoulbear
text: My boss is named Mr. Weldon pass it on

name: lolsworth
text: No.

name: dusty
text:
Lets just skip to the end of this game:
I could only save Mr.Wadaan, a Pashtun.

name: sweetlips
text: I guess Beef has a deep connection with Aibos after all, he is part one.

name: afastidioushat
text: I don't know why, but I think my favorite thing about Roast Beef is that he owns an Enos Slaughter rookie card.

name: greymantledwolf
text: A comment left by greymantledwolf was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, gussiejives, STUART)

name: thegrapist
text: Second

name: deusoma
text: Third

name: overmedicated
text: A comment left by overmedicated was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by shoesandhats, straw, jthm_guitarist, hectik, starch, clintisiceman)

name: rowboat
text: The thought of Grimace as a rapist beats 'em all. Pure, unleaded nightmare fuel.

name: sortelli
text: He's only a grapist

name: gormster
text:
He only rapes grapes?

That would explain why he's purple.

name: tekende
text: It really wouldn't, you know.

name: semiquaver
text: grapist --> gray rapist I assume.  Gray rape = taking sexual advantage of someone under uncertain conditions (gray as in not black and white).

name: thegrapist
text:
He's Grape colored

Huhhuuhhuhuhuhuhuuhuhuuhhuhhuhuhuhuhuuhuhhhuuhuhuhuh

name: rowboat
text: And he's a rapist. I swear.

name: semiquaver
text: Kids these days.

name: thegrapist
text: More like Occam's razor, motherfucks.

name: boredom_man
text:
You are not a kid, but an Occam's razor.

Admitting that I might have misunderstood, that doesn't sound like a step up.

name: farqussus
text: I would have thought he forced grapes into the orifices of other unwilling beings.

name: semiquaver
text: Oh wow it's like I was drunk or exhausted.  This comment is so e-tarded.

name: intergalactic_
text: Youtube "the grapist" and watch the first video there. Classic.

name: stuart
text: Link to relevant Onion article

name: deusoma
text: Why thank you.

name: machegav
text: Hedonism-bot is heavily underrated anyway; keep representin'.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
I found some of those oldies in the street when I was a kid. Slaughter, the Waners, Wagner, Cobb.

My mom gave away all my cards to a kid down the street.

name: philophobe
text: The Sadness of life.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: I'm sure I would have frittered them away in equally pathetic fashion if I'd had the chance.

name: deimosrising
text: A comment left by deimosrising was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by dboothe, kenthegod, rmango)

name: hellofyellin
text: A cookie for who can tell me other comics in which Roast Beef busts out the period at the end of his sentences.

name: zem
text: the previous one. ha!

name: hellofyellin
text:
Beaten like carpaccio.

Well done sir.

name: hellofyellin
text:
You don't know, do you?

That's because there are none.

name: hellofyellin
text:
That's because there are one

Fixed. Just saying a period is six kinds of serious with Beef, is all I'm saying.

name: hollis
text: A comment left by hollis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, Simms, peterjoel, blarghamagarky)

name: heccibiggs
text: I don't know why this has received four lames; it must be because it is so bang on the money .

name: hellofyellin
text: That is another thing we all should say.

name: sargasm
text: So, is he yelling at the closed door, or what?

name: nurdbot
text: Yeah Beef! stick it to the Hag. I also like how Beef announces the news to Ray.

name: professorhazard
text: Ray is naked in panel six.

name: tekende
text: That is some sweet beans professorhazard

name: dougthehead
text: Another thing you'll notice is that everyone can see Beef's changed, somehow.  Ray's expression shows it, and Ray's grandmother definitely saw something new, or she wouldn't have gotten to the bedroom door in time to slam it shut.  He's just become more assertive, I guess.

name: nilehus
text:
Beef's grandmother?

And you're right. Confidence, maybe? God knows it'd be one of the first times Beef's been able to feel it, poor guy.

name: darkwaffle
text: Enos Slaughter could not have a better name.

name: aarongstock
text: What about "Urban Shocker"?

name: taiiga
text: TAKE IT SLEAZY!

name: cthulhu235
text: Word, definitely the best part.

name: paintrain
text: creeks DESERVE exclamation points

name: soticoto
text: Panel 3 is the winner in this comic.

name: cousinted
text: I brought you this casserole, neighbor.

name: shoinan
text: Didn't this happen in The Fresh Prince of Bel Air? Man, Achewood makes the Fresh Prince look like Bill Cosby.

name: flaaron
text:
The fact that Gramma K instilled a fear of creeks into Beef makes me incredibly sad, as they were clearly a source of comfort to the dude.

At least he seems to have overcome that particular hurtle, recently .

name: belgand
text:
More than that people should just plain not be afraid of creeks. Creeks are not a thing to be afraid of. They are a source of joy and exploration for children. A place teenagers engage in awkward make-outs and later, perhaps, awkward sexing of various types and flavors. They flood slightly and mean you need to go down and get the pumpkins now or they'll be totally ruined. They are a sign of the times as all know when the creek is rising it is a portent of trouble. They are one of the primary features of Hazzard County.

Creeks = Awesome

name: fineoakstructure
text:
You got a chubby for creeks (from me and for them).

Oh, that whole sentence just doesn't pan out...

name: belgand
text:
I was being, perhaps, a bit disingenuous as although I enjoyed creeks in my childhood I would now want nothing at all to do with a creek. Creeks are emblematic of rural places and rural places are, by definition, terrible places.

Still, I can acknowledge the importance of creeks otherwise. They are definitely not to be feared.

name: beansdooma
text: funny how weldon never shows up again

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Onstad: Truffles

name: drago25
text: Man I hope I'm soon friends with someone with a poolshed so's I can use that line

name: charchar
text: I've done that taking food from strangers.  "Hi.  My name's charchar and we are friends." *Grabs handful of fries*

name: i_love_kate
text: Twice as funny is you imagine charchar then escaping with a hasty Funny Walk.

name: charchar
text:
I read this post yesterday and waited to resond until after trying it out.

I tripped.

You are a bad influence.

Chubby for making some angsty teenagers laugh.

name: i_love_kate
text: Dude, no-one can effectively emulate the Funny Walk! Is this not something that every budding young Monty Python fan learns early on?

name: charchar
text: I dared to dream.

name: heccibiggs
text: I am so glad that the alt-text explained the fear or creeks.

name: geysershitdick
text:
As does this blog entry by Molly:

http://mollysanders.blogspot.com/2004/07/roast-beef-is-so-silly.html

name: mattylite
text:
Enos Slaughter is maybe most remembered for his "mad dash" from first to home in the 1946 series:
[img src=http://img.timeinc.net/time/2003/worldseries/moments/images/main_9.jpg]

Maybe it is, like, a metaphor or something.

name: mattylite
text:
SCREW YOU, BBCODE! FUCK YOU!
[IMGS OFF]

name: the_voice
text: It would be so awesome to hit the road with a kit like that.

name: empy
text:
I was taking a drink just as I read the last panel.
There is pepsi all over my monitor.

name: fuzzery
text:
Is it just me, or does anyone else crack up whenever they see "Soon." printed on that big black header?

Perhaps it is the tone of voice I imagine it being said in, one full of otherworldly portentousness and a distinctly sinister air.

name: tommythebrat
text: I like to pretend Ray and Roast Beef don't know each other just to make this comic funnier.

name: jaredwilde
text: Sweet sweet catharsis

name: carlyle
text: If you took out every single comic referencing Beef and Ray knowing each other this would be as good an introduction as any.

name: lolsworth
text: I wish someone would knock on my door and say "I live in your poolshed now. Hi."

name: skyisfalling
text: Because it would mean you had a poolshed, or because you are dangerously lonely?

name: lolsworth
text: Both!
